headline: Moving Narratives
abstract: The choreographer Mariana Valencia has gone from making “abstract quiet dances” to using autobiography to engage, often in comic ways, with audiences.
lead_paragraph: Growing up in Chicago in the 1980s, the choreographer Mariana Valencia began making dance steps long before she knew what choreography was. From the ages of 2 to 5, she had a recurring gig on public access television, as a guest on the Spanish-language children’s show “El Club del Niño.”
